page.title: 03LANDSCAPE.N.FAREHAM'S RIVERS
page.content: The river Wallington is about 3 metres wide and 50 cm deep,it flows quite fast.On the banks there are white nettles and cow parsley.The landscape is flat.The Meon is in a valley which in the west, is quite steep sided,but in the east is a flat flood plain with poor,rough pasture used only for horses.It is wider and deeper than the Wallington,it is about 6 metres wide and 1 metre 50 cm deep.The water is used in the sewage farm which serves Wickham village.The water is clear as the river carries little sediment.Local residents walk beside the river for recreation,and there is some coarse fishing.
